g.title:
<
5. d4
mainLine
Lot of tension in the center.5. .. exd4 6.
exd5Instead of taking back with the pawn and
ending up in IQP for black6. .. Nf3to
continue development. White can take the
extra pawn7. dxc6 Nxc6pawn for quick development.
Better version of IQP for black.
A typical continuation would be8. Be2 0-0
9. 0-0 Bc7 10. Nb3 Bb6to defend the isolated
pawn. Black's white squared bishop can then
develop to f5 or g4 and his rook to e8.
>
g.text: Lot of tension in the center.
Instead of taking back with the pawn and
ending up in IQP for black
continue development. White can take the
Better version of IQP for black.
pawn. Black's white squared bishop can then
develop to f5 or g4 and his rook to e8.

g.title:
<
White's options
>-><
5. d4
mainLine
Lot of tension in the center.5. .. exd4 6.
exd5Instead of taking back with the pawn and
ending up in IQP for black6. .. Nf3to
continue development. White can take the
extra pawn7. dxc6 Nxc6pawn for quick development.
Better version of IQP for black.
A typical continuation would be8. Be2 0-0
9. 0-0 Bc7 10. Nb3 Bb6to defend the isolated
pawn. Black's white squared bishop can then
develop to f5 or g4 and his rook to e8.
>

<
5. g3
With the idea of weakening d5 after
fiancettoing the bishop.5. .. Nf6 6. Bg2 0-0 7. 0-0
Re8Keep the tension in the middle, don't
lock down the position with d4 with black.
>
g.text: With the idea of weakening d5 after
Keep the tension in the middle, don't
lock down the position with d4 with black.

Nd7
With the idea of b6 and Bb7 or queen side
expansion with a5

Nd7
With the idea of b6 and Bb7 or queen side
expansion with a5
>

<
Bg4
If kicked away can retreat back to g6 that
is a good square for the bishop.
>
g.text: If kicked away can retreat back to g6 that
is a good square for the bishop.

g.title:
<
5. g3
With the idea of weakening d5 after
fiancettoing the bishop.5. .. Nf6 6. Bg2 0-0 7. 0-0
Re8Keep the tension in the middle, don't
lock down the position with d4 with black.
>-><
Bg4
If kicked away can retreat back to g6 that
is a good square for the bishop.
>

<
The Breyer variation
1. e4 c6 2. d3 d5
usually continues with3. Nd2as black
immediately threatens with exchanging pawns
and queens and deny castling for white.
Followed by3. .. e5as the white not controlling e5 as
it usually does in the Caro-Kann. Then4.
Ngf3 Bd6to attack black's e pawn and defending
it.
>
g.text: and queens and deny castling for white.
as the white not controlling e5 as
it usually does in the Caro-Kann. Then
to attack black's e pawn and defending

g.title:
<
The Breyer variation
1. e4 c6 2. d3 d5
usually continues with3. Nd2as black
immediately threatens with exchanging pawns
and queens and deny castling for white.
Followed by3. .. e5as the white not controlling e5 as
it usually does in the Caro-Kann. Then4.
Ngf3 Bd6to attack black's e pawn and defending
it.
>-><
White's options
>
